Monster ID7286

Skotizo is a demonic boss located beneath the Catacombs of Kourend. Accessing his lair requires the use of a dark totem on the altar found in the centre of the Catacombs; one dark totem permits only one attempt, which makes it a sporadic boss.

Skotizo can be substituted for both Black demon and Greater demon kills during Slayer tasks. Skotizo's Lair is part of the Catacombs of Kourend, and does count as such for the purpose of Konar slayer tasks. He cannot be damaged with a ring of recoil.

History[edit | edit source]

Skotizo was a general of Zamorak during the God Wars, but he was often outshined by Zamorak's more notable generals, such as Thammaron and K'ril Tsutsaroth. He is also Zalcano's brother.

After the cunning he and his soldiers showed at the Battle of Carrallangar, Zamorak personally gave them their next mission, something he rarely did. The mission was to lead an expedition to recover a certain artefact in the Karamjan Temple found within the Kharazi Jungle. Skotizo was delighted by being assigned the mission and set out as soon as possible to please his god.

Reaching the Temple after a few days, Skotizo and his squad had managed to reach the Temple's centre after navigating a large maze. Now in possession of the artefact, Skotizo betrayed his squad, taking the artefact's power for himself and decimating the expedition team. Zamorak held Zalcano responsible for Skotizo's treachery, cursing her to turn into stone until she brings her brother before him.

Skotizo managed to avoid Zamorak's wrath and travelled to Great Kourend, where he used the artefact to summon a large variety of monsters, creating what is known today as the Catacombs of Kourend. Skotizo remained in the large chamber underneath the catacombs; roughly 200 years after the Kourend civil war, he encountered and killed an adventurer who stumbled into his chamber while investigating mysterious disappearances.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 18,964 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Skotizo kill is worth 176,536.11.

The average Skotizo kill while on a Konar task is worth 178,624.62.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve Skotizo.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Skotizo Champion Kill Skotizo once. Medium Kill count
Demonic Weakening Kill Skotizo with no altars active. Medium Mechanical
Demonbane Weaponry Kill Skotizo with a demonbane weapon equipped. Medium Restriction
Skotizo Adept Kill Skotizo 5 times. Hard Kill count
Demon Evasion Kill Skotizo without taking any damage. Elite Perfection
Up for the Challenge Kill Skotizo without equipping a demonbane weapon. Elite Restriction
Precise Positioning Kill Skotizo with the final source of damage being a Chinchompa explosion. Master Restriction

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
9 December 2021
(update)

The minimum HiScores killcount required for Skotizo has been lowered from 10 to 5.

16 June 2021
(update | poll)

Skotizo now drops infernal ashes in place of regular ashes.

4 May 2017
(update | poll)

Skotos and dark claws have been added as possible drops from Skotizo.

28 July 2016
(update | poll)

Skotizo's elite clue scroll drop rate increased from 1/50 to 1/5.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • "Skotízo" ("σκοτίζω") is Ancient Greek for darkening, referencing Skotizo's dark appearance and demonic nature.
  • Skotizo is the only monster that has the shield left half as part of his normal drop table; all other monsters that drop it do so indirectly via the rare drop table.
  • Skotizo had a festive override wearing a black santa hat during the 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019 Christmas events.

References[edit | edit source]

The main table has a 1/100 chance of calling this sub-table. On the sub-table, it's a 1/10 chance of giving an onyx and a 9/10 chance of giving 10x banknoted dragonstones."
  3. ↑ 3.0 3.1 3.2 3.3 Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 3 January 2021. (Archived from the original on 3 January 2021.) Mod Ash: "[Skotizo's] got a 1/128 chance of giving the full totem, and a 3/128 chance of giving a piece."
